title: 'Mi, Sunetra Ajit Pawar, pratigya karte ki … ': 'Clock' ticks on in a changed NCP
content: With Sunetra Pawar, Ajit Pawar’s wife and a Rajya Sabha member, sworn in as deputy CM on Saturday, stepping into the role held by her husband, the state has formally entered a new and uncertain phase, shaped by the vacuum left by Dada’s death. Sunetra Pawar’s elevation may have filled the immediate constitutional vacuum, but it has also foregrounded larger, unresolved questions about the NCP’s future, the ruling Mahayuti alliance’s stability, and the direction the state’s politics will take in the absence of one of its most influential power brokers.

title: Budget 2026: When arithmetic takes the stage on Sunday at 11 am
content: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman's Budget 2026 prioritizes continuity and fiscal discipline over populist measures.  Expect a focus on debt-to-GDP reduction and strategic capital expenditure, particularly in defense and manufacturing.  The budget signals a sober fiscal script, aiming for reassurance rather than grand pronouncements, with bond markets keenly watching for sustained credibility.

title: 'Trashy ruminations of a convicted criminal': MEA rubbishes reference to PM Modi in Epstein files
content: India's Ministry of External Affairs has vehemently dismissed claims linking Prime Minister Narendra Modi to Jeffrey Epstein's leaked documents.  The ministry labelled the references as "trashy ruminations" from a convicted criminal, urging their immediate rejection. These statements follow the US Department of Justice's release of extensive materials related to the late financier.

title: Explosions reported at two locations in Iran; Israel denies involvement
content: A powerful explosion ripped through an eight-storey building in Iran's Bandar Abbas port city, causing significant damage to its structure, vehicles, and shops. While the cause remains under investigation, authorities have dismissed claims of a targeted attack. The incident occurs amidst escalating regional tensions and ongoing domestic unrest.

title: 'Big Short' Michael Burry says he is glad Elon Musk is in America, but urges caution
content: Renowned investor Michael Burry has lauded Elon Musk as an 'American treasure' but cautioned his ambitious future visions are distant. Burry sees Musk as a 'desperate incentivised futurist,' comparing him to showmen and inventors.

title: IPL: 'Wicket li toh pa'er chhu lunga' - PBKS spinner shares his Kohli dream
content: Punjab Kings' new signing Vishal Nishad revealed Virat Kohli's profound influence on his cricket career, calling him his idol. Nishad shared his challenging journey, overcoming family doubts and financial struggles to reach the IPL. He credits his tennis-ball background and supportive coach for his development as a bowler.

title: 'Film stars come and go': Piyush Goyal plays down actor Vijay’s impact on Tamil Nadu polls
content: Union minister Piyush Goyal dismissed actor Vijay's potential impact on Tamil Nadu elections, stating "many film stars come and go" and fan following doesn't guarantee votes. He expressed confidence in the AIADMK-led NDA alliance, citing strong anti-incumbency against the DMK government and visible rifts within their alliance.

title: Google cofounder makes biggest-ever public donation to tackle California housing crisis
content: Google co-founder Sergey Brin has made his largest public donation, contributing $20 million to a new coalition tackling California's housing crisis. This significant move, backed by other tech leaders, comes as the state's wealthy face a potential wealth tax. Brin's philanthropy has been substantial, with billions donated to various causes, including climate solutions and medical research.

title: How Sensex, Nifty have performed on Budget days in the past
content: ​Budgets set the direction for government spending, taxation, and growth priorities, but actual execution takes time. Sectors like infrastructure, railways, defence, and capital goods tend to react positively to higher capex announcements, while banks and consumption stocks respond to tax relief or income-support measures.

title: In a first, Union Budget 2026 to be presented on Sunday
content: India's Union Budget 2026-27 will be presented on a Sunday for the first time in history, a significant procedural reform. Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman also achieves a record ninth consecutive budget presentation, marking a new milestone in the nation's financial reporting tradition.

title: Nvidia H-1B data reveals US pay as Jensen Huang reviews all compensation
content: Nvidia's soaring stock has created millionaires among its employees, with H-1B visa filings revealing substantial base salaries for critical roles. While CEO Jensen Huang emphasizes personal involvement in compensation, earlier hires have significantly benefited from equity appreciation. The data offers a glimpse into the pay for engineers, architects, researchers, and product managers, excluding bonuses and equity.

title: 'Oh my god': SKY goes viral after tricking crowd over Samson - Watch
content: India captain Suryakumar Yadav entertained fans before the fifth T20I against New Zealand by playfully pretending to forget Sanju Samson’s name at the toss in Thiruvananthapuram. He later confirmed Samson’s inclusion, drawing cheers from the crowd. India chose to bat first due to dew concerns. With the series already in India's pocket, the match served as preparation for the upcoming T20 World Cup.

title: Sunetra Pawar is new Maha dy CM: Wives who inherited husbands' political legacy
content: Sunetra Pawar has been sworn in as Maharashtra's Deputy Chief Minister, succeeding her late husband Ajit Pawar. Elected NCP legislature party leader, she will assume his portfolios, excluding finance. This move echoes historical instances of women stepping into politics to uphold family legacies after their husbands' passing.

title: Economic Survey: Degrees are rising, job certainty isn’t; tomorrow’s Budget gets tested here
content: The Economic Survey 2025–26 reads like a map of where Indian education quietly loses people—after Class 8, at the school-to-work handover, and in the steady outward rush of students seeking predictability. On Budget eve, the question isn’t another scheme. It’s whether spending will strengthen the weak joints—so families don’t have to keep paying privately for certainty.

title: 'Give me Zimbabwe or I'll retire': Babar Azam falls for 2; triggers criticism
content: Babar Azam's struggles continued in the T20I series against Australia, as he was dismissed for just 2 runs by Adam Zampa in the second match. This low score has sparked debate on social media, with some questioning his place in Pakistan's T20 squad.

title: 'Insult to fans': Pakistan cricket erupts; slams Australia amid T20 WC row
content: Pakistan expresses concern over visiting SENA teams resting key players, following a second-string Australia's T20I loss. Australia's decision to rest several top players for the series, citing recovery and World Cup preparation, has drawn criticism from former Pakistani cricketers and analysts who view it as an insult to their cricket.

title: Gold, silver price crash: $5 trillion lost in market cap! What led to the spectacular fall
content: Gold prices dropped by a whopping Rs 14,000 per 10 grams and silver prices tanked by Rs 20,000 per kg in Delhi on Friday. The sharp dip came after gold hit a fresh high of Rs 1,83,000 and silver of Rs 4,04,500 on Thursday.

title: WWE Royal Rumble 2026: Full card, predictions and 30th entrant tease
content: WWE's historic Royal Rumble 2026 in Riyadh features a stacked card, including AJ Styles' career-ending match against Gunther and Sami Zayn defending the Undisputed WWE Championship against Drew McIntyre. Both 30-person Royal Rumble matches are set to headline the event, with predictions favoring Liv Morgan for the women's match and Roman Reigns or Bron Breakker for the men's.

title: Kit launch cancelled! Are Pakistan on the brink of boycotting the T20 World Cup?
content: Pakistan's participation in the ICC T20 World Cup 2026 is shrouded in uncertainty despite squad announcements and scheduled departure. Rumors of a boycott persist, fueled by a cancelled kit launch and PCB's stance on security concerns, with a final decision expected soon.

title: 'Will keep Dada's ideals alive': Sunetra Pawar after dy CM oath; gets key portfolios
content: Sunetra Pawar took oath as Deputy Chief Minister of Maharashtra, vowing to carry forward her late husband Ajit Pawar's legacy. She expressed being "overwhelmed with emotions" while accepting the responsibility, emphasizing her commitment to working tirelessly for the state's development and its people.

title: Budget 2026: No mention in Constitution, Sunday presentation & more — 10 facts
content: India's Union Budget, a key economic event, holds many fascinating historical details.  The Constitution calls it the 'Annual Financial Statement'.  This year's budget presentation on a Sunday is a first.  From colonial-era evening timings to the shift to February 1, traditions have evolved.  The 'bahi khata' now symbolizes Indian identity.  The railway budget is now integrated.

title: Setback for World No. 1 Sabalenka! Rybakina lifts Australian Open title
content: Elena Rybakina won the Australian Open title by defeating world number one Aryna Sabalenka 6-4, 4-6, 6-4, avenging her 2023 final loss. She recovered from a 3-0 deficit in the deciding set, won five straight games, and sealed victory with an ace. The triumph marked her second Grand Slam title after Wimbledon 2022 and highlighted her mental strength and growing confidence on big stages.

title: Epstein files: Photo shows Prince Andrew in all fours over a woman
content: Newly released US Justice Department documents reveal Prince Andrew in photographs on all fours with a woman. The files also detail Epstein's attempts to introduce a Russian woman to the Duke, discussing potential meetings and a dinner at Buckingham Palace. Andrew has consistently denied any wrongdoing related to Epstein.

title: ‘Criticism doesn’t matter’: Bhaker not setting medal goals for Asian Championship
content: Olympic medallist Manu Bhaker says criticism no longer affects her as she prepares for the Asian Rifle/Pistol Championship in Delhi. The 23-year-old credits maturity, experience, and public support since her two Paris 2024 bronze medals for her positive mindset. Competing at home excites rather than pressures her. Feeling fit and focused, Bhaker has avoided medal expectations, instead setting personal performance standards.

title: 'Really looking forward': Shashi Tharoor excited for Sanju Samson's homecoming T20I
content: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor is excited for the final T20I between India and New Zealand. He wishes luck to Team India and local player Sanju Samson. The match is a big occasion for Thiruvananthapuram fans. It is also India's last game before the T20 World Cup. India leads the series 3-1.

title: Jhanvi Kukreja murder case: Accused Shree Jogdhankar convicted; co-accused Diya Padalkar acquitted
content: In a 2021 murder case, a Mumbai sessions court is hearing the trial of Shree Jogdhankar and Diya Padalkar for the death of 19-year-old Jhanvi Kukreja. Kukreja was found dead with 48 injuries after a New Year's Eve party. The prosecution presented circumstantial evidence, including CCTV footage and forensic reports, to establish the chain of events.

title: New details emerge as FBI links Ryan Wedding’s wife and inner circle to drug killings
content: Former Olympic snowboarder Ryan Wedding has pleaded not guilty to federal charges tied to drug trafficking and murder. US authorities say he led a billion-dollar drug ring uncovered through Operation Giant Slalom. Several alleged associates, including his wife, girlfriend, lawyer, and international partners, have been sanctioned, arrested, or face extradition, according to the FBI and US Department of Justice.

title: 'Not my day, but I gave everything': Sinner reacts after Djokovic ends Australian Open run
content: World No. 2 Jannik Sinner graciously acknowledged his Australian Open semi-final defeat to Novak Djokovic, admitting the loss hurt but commending the Serbian's performance. Despite a strong effort and recent wins against Djokovic, Sinner converted only two of 18 break points. He expressed gratitude for fan support and vowed to learn from the experience.

title: Sonam Wangchuk taken to AIIMS in Jodhpur after stomach pain complain;
content: Jailed activist Sonam Wangchuk underwent a medical examination at AIIMS Jodhpur following a Supreme Court directive.  The court is reviewing his detention under the NSA, with his wife challenging the grounds. Wangchuk, reportedly suffering from stomach ailments, has raised concerns about his health, prompting the specialist examination.

title: Denied access to funeral ground, Dalits light pyre on Bihar road
content: Dalit villagers in Bihar's Vaishali were allegedly prevented from using the local cremation ground, forcing them to cremate a 91-year-old woman on a public road. The incident, which occurred in Sondho-Vashudeo village, has sparked tensions and prompted an official inquiry into the alleged discrimination.

title: 'Ajit Dada amar rahe': Sunetra Pawar takes oath as Maharashtra deputy CM 3 days after husband's death
content: Sunetra Pawar has been sworn in as Maharashtra's deputy chief minister, stepping into the role previously held by her husband, Ajit Pawar, following his tragic passing. She will assume his responsibilities, excluding the finance portfolio. This significant political transition occurred after her unanimous election as the NCP legislative party leader.

title: Blue drum murders: A chilling pattern of spousal betrayal and brutal killings
content: A gruesome murder in Meerut, involving a body sealed in a blue drum, has sparked a wave of similar crimes across multiple states. These cases highlight patterns of domestic betrayal, third-party involvement, and extreme methods used to conceal murder, leaving investigators and the public deeply uneasy.

title: Trichy bus driver slaps passenger multiple times for asking him to avoid rash driving
content: A private bus driver in Trichy was arrested after assaulting a passenger who requested him to slow down due to rash driving. The incident, captured on video, escalated into a physical altercation at the bus stand. The driver faces charges including voluntarily causing hurt and criminal intimidation.

title: ‘Maa, Maati, Manush unsafe in Bengal’: Amit Shah targets Mamata Banerjee at BJP meet
content: Union Home Minister Amit Shah launched a scathing attack on West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee, accusing her government of failing women, people, and land while fostering corruption and infiltration for votes. Shah highlighted concerns over border security, the Anandpur fire incident, and alleged intimidation of communities, urging voters to elect a BJP government for national security and development.

title: No one from my family will attend Sunetra’s oath-taking ceremony: Sharad Pawar
content: Sharad Pawar expressed surprise regarding Sunetra Pawar's oath-taking ceremony, stating he was neither consulted nor informed. He confirmed no family members would attend, attributing the decision to party leaders Sunil Tatkare and Praful Patel. Pawar learned of Sunetra's selection as deputy chief minister through news reports, emphasizing it was an internal party matter.

title: Triple murder: Man kills parents, sister, buries bodies in rented house
content: A shocking triple murder has rocked Kottur, where a man, Akshay Kumar, allegedly killed his parents and sister. The victims were reportedly buried within their rented home. Akshay later filed a missing persons report in Bengaluru, attempting to mislead authorities. He confessed to the crime during police interrogation. The motive remains unclear as investigations continue.

title: Getting into a live-in while already being in one will attract up to 7 yrs’ jail: U’khand UCC
content: Uttarakhand's Uniform Civil Code (Amendment) Ordinance introduces stringent penalties, including up to seven years imprisonment, for offences related to marriage and live-in relationships. The amendments aim to clarify provisions, enhance effectiveness, and strengthen citizen rights, incorporating stricter punishment clauses following the implementation of new criminal laws.

title: 'Border 2' box office day 9 : Sunny Deol's war drama crosses 238 crore on 2nd Saturday
content: Sunny Deol's 'Border 2' continues its impressive box office run, raking in Rs 245 crore domestically and Rs 323 crore worldwide. Despite a competitive release, the war epic, a spiritual successor to the 1997 hit, is drawing crowds. The film, featuring a star-studded cast, strategically utilized the Republic Day holiday for a strong opening.

title: Dredging of Upputeru sought to check crop inundation in West Godavari district
content: Fresh survey to be carried out for canal modernisation in Godavari delta; Tanuku MLA highlights the need for a retaining wall along Gosthani river

title: Private agri. varsity study selected for showcasing at ISTA meet in Canada
content: The AI-based seed germination evaluation system tested on 62 paddy, maize, bajra varieties enhances accuracy of testing

title: Congress not against high-speed rail project, says Satheesan
content: The Leader of the Opposition said the project must be environmentally sustainable and financially viable for Kerala

title: Zero-tolerance for terrorism must be uncompromising universal norm: Jaishankar
content: In an address at the second India-Arab Foreign Ministers' Meeting, he also asserted that societies targeted by terrorism have the right to defend themselves and will "understandably exercise it".

title: Vigilance wing seizes banned gutka worth ₹2.72 crore in Tirupati region
content: Over 2,020 bags of prohibited tobacco products seized in coordinated raids across Tirupati and Chittoor districts; cases booked against traders and transporters, officials warn of zero tolerance on illegal trade

title: A month since major blaze, Broadway firefighting plans yet to take off
content: While there is no word yet from the authorities on chalking out a concrete plan to keep the street safe from potential fire accidents, steps are yet to be initiated to decongest the roads which remain the biggest challenge for firefighters to navigate through the street in case of an emergency

title: Two polytechnic lecturers suspended over fake research publications
content: The lecturers were found to have submitted predatory journals along with their applications for the career advancement scheme

title: Government in the process of developing a NoRKA police station: Kerala Chief Minister
content: Speaking at the valedictory session of the fifth Loka Kerala Sabha, Pinarayi Vijayan criticises Union government for its ‘serious inaction” in introducing the draft Overseas Mobility (Facilitation and Welfare) Bill in Parliament

title: Kerala for All conclave: State’s political legacy will not allow curbs on people, says expert
content: The latest social media-fuelled tourism, especially ‘Insta tourism,’ triggers mass movement of people to one place or another destination for a certain period, leaving an impact on the environment and ecology around the destinations, says D. Dhanuraj, Founder-Chairman of CPPR

title: Kerala for All conclave: Design public spaces to ensure access for all, says Manoj Kumar Kini
content: We cannot merely emulate urban design models from developed countries and need to evolve a model suited to our own context, says Biju Kuriakose, co-founder of architectureRED

title: Expectations from Union Budget run high in poll-bound Kerala
content: The report of the 16th Finance Commission, likely to be tabled in Parliament, pushes up expectations as the State is anticipating a better deal than it received under the 15th panel.  In January, Kerala had presented a hefty wish list to the Union Minister, which included a ₹21,000-crore ‘special fiscal correction package’ assistance for establishing a Defence R&D Corridor and a Rare Earth Corridor and an an additional borrowing space of 0.5% of Gross State Domestic product

title: Week-long math training programme held at IIT-Dharwad
content: IIT-Dharwad partnered with the Mathematics Training and Talent Search (MTTS) Trust to conduct the programme.

title: Davos meet: Had fruitful meetings with Tata Sons, 46 other firms, says M.B. Patil
content: The delegation consciously decided not to sign MoUs at Davos because the government wants global investors to personally visit Karnataka and see State’s potential: Minister

title: AIKS plans nationwide farmers’ agitation against NDA govt.’s policies
content: Farmers will extend support to the nationwide strike called by trade unions on February 12, opposing the four new Labour Codes, says All India Kisan Sabha

title: Kuppam to be developed as major industrial hub, says Chandrababu Naidu
content: 21 industrial units with ₹7,684 crore investment planned as Chief Minister outlines vision for jobs, renewable energy and infrastructure-led growth in the tri-State constituency

title: Assam CM dragging Supreme Court into his anti-Miya narrative: Gaurav Gogoi
content: The State Congress president and MP said that after he raised the issue of contempt of court, Himanta Biswa Sarma went quiet.

title: Kerala SIR: LDF to take out march to CEO office on February 2 over anomalies
content: LDF convener says that there have been allegations that the SIR was an attempt to indirectly prepare a National Population Register

title: Kerala for All conclave: Experts flag lack of empathy, continuous education of architects as key barriers to universal accessibility
content: Flagging absence of proper dissemination of information, expert says only  a small percentage of architects are aware that building designs must incorporate accessibility standards

title: Four migrant workers from Assam found dead in labour shed near Hoskote in Karnataka; suffocation suspected
content: Sulibele Police have filed an Unnatural Death Report (UDR) and a probe is underway to see whether there was negligence on the part of the employer or contractor in providing unsafe accommodation to the workers

title: Sanjeevani Project will be rolled out across Andhra Pradesh: Chief Minister
content: Technology-driven public health initiative, piloted in Kuppam, will enable patients to book doctor appointments through mobile phones and strengthen preventive healthcare, the Chief Minister says

title: Palliative care training workshop in Hubballi on Feb. 4
content: ‘The workshop is open to all participants. The training will focus on educating families on caring for cancer patients at home, especially after discharge from the hospital’

title: Kerala for All conclave: Kerala rides the Responsible Tourism wave
content: The project to develop community-based tourism activities that offer an engaging experience for tourists has become a huge success story in tourism over the years, says Rupeshkumar, chief executive officer, Kerala RT Mission Society

title: Water woes: HDMC to hold special meeting with L&T officials on February 10
content: Deputy Mayor of Hubballi Dharwad Santosh Chavan, who was chairing the monthly general body meeting of the Hubballi Dharwad Municipal Corporation in the absence of Mayor Jyoti Patil in Hubballi on January 31, made the announcement after the council meeting witnessed an uproar over the issue.

title: MRPS leader succumbs to injuries following ‘attack’ in Kurnool
content: According to police, Ramesh was assaulted by unidentified persons on Friday night while returning from an evening walk

title: ‘Munnorukkam’ to help SSLC students prepare for exams
content: KITE programme to familiarise students with new exam patterns to begin on Sunday with focus on ICT and robotics

title: Floor committee to be formed to inquire into illegal sale of lands on fake documents
content: Chairing the monthly council meeting of the Hubballi Dharwad Municipal Corporation in the absence of Mayor Jyoti Patil in Hubballi on January 31, Mr. Chavan said that it is a matter of serious concern and he will also be a part of the committee.

title: Chittoor district enters Guinness World Records as CM distributes 5,555 e-cycles
content: Naidu pedals for green mobility as the district sets a global milestone within 24 hours. DWCRA women benefit from solar-powered transport, with the government planning dedicated cycle tracks to support sustainable commuting

title: Kerala for All conclave: Many inclusive tourism initiatives lack the ‘queer’ factor, says Keshav Suri
content: Akash Hingorani, Principal Architect at Oasis Designs, expresses concern over most Indian cities still grappling with shortage of inclusively designed public spaces

title: Migrant workers' death: Himanta to raise matter with Karnataka CM
content: Four migrant labourers from Assam were found dead at their rented accommodation in Sulibele area in Hoskote taluk in a suspected case of suffocation, police said

title: Realtor Roy’s death: Kerala ruling front and opposition demand transparent investigation
content: Leader of the Opposition V.D. Satheesan demanded a fair and transparent enquiry into Mr. Joy’s death. Industries Minister P. Rajeeve said Mr. Roy’s death during an Income Tax raid was shocking and had a chilling effect on the business sector in Kerala

title: Odisha Cabinet clears ₹17,250-cr Kalyani Group manufacturing complex in Dhenkanal
content: Odisha Cabinet also approves the continuation of international flights with State viability gap funding (VGF) support.

title: SIT headed by Joint Commissioner of Police to probe C.J. Roy death case
content: The Special Investigation Team will be headed by C. Vamsi Krishna, Joint Commissioner of Police, West Zone

title: Inside the 'most dangerous gym in America,' where Eagles' WR A.J. Brown trained
content: Diamond Gym doesn't just build muscle -- it tests the resolve of everyone who walks through the door.

title: Giants co-owner Tisch named in latest Epstein file...
content: Giants co-owner Steve Tisch's name appears at least 440 times among millions of documents in the latest release of Jeffrey Epstein files, including some that show Epstein connected him to numerous women.

title: Rybakina rallies to stop Sabalenka for Aussie titl...
content: Elena Rybakina won the Australian Open title with a 6-4, 4-6, 6-4 victory over top-ranked Aryna Sabalenka that avenged her loss in the championship decider in 2023.

title: Sources: Seahawks to go up for sale after SB LX
content: The Seahawks will go up for sale after Super Bowl LX, league and ownership sources familiar with the arrangement told ESPN.

title: Unrivaled draws record crowd of 21,490 in Philly
content: Unrivaled co-founder Napheesa Collier said it was "unbelievable" to see a record 21,490 fans attend the 3-on-3 league's inaugural tour stop in Philadelphia.

title: Draymond: Not losing sleep as Giannis talk swirls
content: As reports swirl over a potential Giannis-to-Golden State trade, Draymond Green says he has "no reason to sit and worry" about his Warriors future but noted he understands trades are part of the business.

title: Sources: Ravens to hire Doyle, 29, to be new OC
content: The Ravens are hiring Bears offensive coordinator Declan Doyle as their offensive coordinator, sources told ESPN's Adam Schefter. Doyle, 29, will be the youngest offensive playcaller in the NFL.

title: Curry exits Warriors' loss with nagging sore knee
content: Warriors star Stephen Curry was ruled out during the second half of Friday night's game against the Pistons with right knee soreness.

title: Wilson, A's reach agreement on 7-year extension
content: All-Star shortstop Jacob Wilson and the Athletics reached agreement on a seven-year contract that includes a club option for an eighth season, the team announced Friday.

content: Before Super Bowl LX kicks off, let's take a look at the year in review, with all the bad beats, teams on repeat and more.

content: Liverpool have made an initial inquiry to Internazionale about signing right back Denzel Dumfries. Transfer Talk has the latest.

content: After five days of shakedown testing at Barcelona, ESPN's F1 analysts reveal what they learned about the state of the field ahead of 2026 rule changes.

title: Chase Elliott is finding his way back to where he ...
content: Last year was the first time Chase Elliott won multiple races in a season since 2022. Can he carry that momentum into the 2026 campaign?

title: What to do with Giannis? The best- and worst-case ...
content: With Giannis Antetokounmpo rumored to be in his final days with Milwaukee, Andre Snellings takes a look at the possible destinations and which would be best and worst for his fantasy value.

title: Abusers "Remain Hidden": Jeffrey Epstein Survivors After Latest Files Release
content: Survivors of Jeffrey Epstein said their alleged abusers "remain hidden and protected" after the US government released millions of new pages from files related to the convicted sex offender on Friday.

title: Girl, 13, Living In Madhya Pradesh Hostel, Gives Birth
content: A 13-year-old girl residing at the Kasturba Gandhi Balika Hostel in Parsamau village, Baihar development block, Balaghat district, Madhya Pradesh, gave birth to a baby girl at the district hospital's maternity ward this week.

title: Cigarettes, Pan Masala To Be Costlier From Feb 1 As New Excise Duty Kicks In
content: From February 1, the government is bringing a new tax structure for cigarettes, tobacco products and pan masala, aiming to tighten regulation and keep tax levels high on these so-called sin goods'.

title: Gujarat Becomes India's No. 1 Renewable Energy Contributor With 16.5% Share
content: Gujarathas emerged as thelargestcontributor toIndias renewable energy capacity, accounting for 16.50 per cent of the national total, with the states installed renewable power reaching 42.583 GW as of December 2025, as per to official figures.

title: Experts Welcome Top Court's Ruling On Menstrual Hygiene
content: The Supreme Courts recognition of menstrual hygiene as a right to life is a landmark step for womens dignity and stigma-free education, said public health experts on Saturday.

title: Sunetra Pawar, Maharashtra's 1st Woman Deputy Chief Minister, Heads 3 Ministries
content: Sunetra Pawar, the wife of Nationalist Congress Party leader Ajit Pawar, took oath as Maharashtra's first woman Deputy Chief Minister today.

title: BRS Calls For Protests In Telangana Over 'Political Harassment' Of KCR
content: BRS party leaders have called for massive protests across Telangana on Sunday to condemn the undemocratic and politically motivated actions being pursued by the current government against Kalvakuntla Chandrashekar Rao.

title: Epstein Aide Ghislaine Maxwell Mugshot Taken During 2020 Arrest Released
content: US authorities have released the mugshot of Ghislaine Maxwell, the convicted sex trafficker and longtime associate of Jeffrey Epstein.

title: 6, Including Schoolchildren, Injured In Suspicious Explosion In Karnataka
content: At least six people, including school-going children, sustained serious injuries after a suspected explosive object detonated on a roadside stretch near Karnataka's Molgi Marayya Temple in Molkera village on Friday.

title: Explosion Reported At Building In Iran, Cause Unkown: Report
content: An explosion took place on Saturday at a building in the Iranian city of Bandar Abbas on the Gulf coast, state media reported, though the cause of the blast was as yet unknown.

title: Two Real Estate Firm Employees Get Bail In Noida Techie Death Case
content: A local court has granted bail to two employees of a real estate firm in connection with the death of a 27-year-old software engineer in Noida earlier this month, lawyers said.

title: Woman Found Partially Burnt In Jharkhand, Family Allege Murder For Dowry
content: The partially burnt body of a young woman found at a forest in Giridih district of Jharkhand has been identified as 21-year-old Sahina Tahul Ansari, a resident of Chino village, police said on Saturday.

title: 5 Dead, 6 Injured After Truck Runs Over 3 Motorcycles In Odisha
content: At least five persons died and six others were critically injured when a truck ran over three two-wheelers in Odisha's Ganjam district, police said on Saturday morning.

title: BJP Leader Manoj Tiwari Files Police Complaint Against Fake Facebook Account
content: BJP Lok Sabha MP Manoj Tiwari has filed a police complaint against a "fake" Facebook account in his name.

title: Man Heading To Delhi Airport To See Off Son Dies In Multi-Vehicle Collision
content: A 55-year-old man died after the taxi he was travelling in got involved in a multi-vehicle collision amid dense fog on the Urban Extension Road-II in Delhi's Dwarka early on Saturday, police said.

title: Waiter At Popular Kolkata Restaurant Arrested For Serving Beef To YouTuber
content: A waiter at a well-known bar-cum-restaurant on Kolkata's Park Street has been arrested after an actor and YouTuber accused the establishment of serving him beef instead of mutton.

title: 'To Entrap, Defame': Bill Gates On Epstein Files' Sex With Russian Girls' Claim
content: Bill Gates has responded to allegations in the Epstein files regarding him contracting sexually transmitted diseases (STDs) after sexual encounters with "Russian girls". Gates called the claims "absolutely absurd and completely false".

title: Woman Forced To Deliver Child On Roadside After Ambulance Fails To Arrive
content: A flickering torchlight. An open road in the dead of night. A tarpaulin pulled up as a makeshift curtain, and beneath it, a woman giving birth.

title: Friend Shree Jogdhankar Gets Life Imprisonment In Jhanvi Kukreja Murder Case
content: A Mumbai court on Saturday delivered its verdict in the sensational 2021 Jhanvi Kukreja murder case, sentencing her friend Shree Jogdhankar to life imprisonment, while acquitting another accused Diya Padalkar.

title: Sonam Wangchuk Taken To AIIMS After Complaining Of Stomach Pain
content: Activist and scientist Sonam Wangchuk, who has been lodged in the Jodhpur Central Jail since September 27, 2025, was taken to AIIMS Jodhpur for medical examination early Saturday morning, officials said.

title: Beijing stages ‘combat readiness’ patrols at Scarborough Shoal in disputed South China Sea
content:
China carried out fresh naval and air patrols around the disputed Scarborough Shoal in the South China Sea, in a move likely to heighten tensions with the Philippines and its treaty ally, the United States. China’s Southern Theater Command said warships and military aircraft conducted "combat readiness" patrols around Scarborough Shoal on Saturday, framing the operation as a response to what it called "infringement provocations of individual countries within the region."

BRICS Member SNUBS Trump’s Drone Push; Indonesia Blocks US Surveillance Request Over South China

According to the state media, a video released by the PLA Southern Theater Command shows an H-6K bomber equipped with YJ-12 anti-ship missiles and the Type 055 large destroyer Xianyang, alongside other PLA warplanes and warships.

title: European live updates: Arsenal aim to bounce back ...
content: It's the final day of January, but we begin another new weekend of matches all across Europe! We start things off in the  Premier League  as  Leeds United  host league leaders  Arsenal , where the league leaders are looking to bounce back following successive games where they were unable to win (a 0-0 draw to  Nottingham Forest  and 3-2 loss to  Manchester United ). Meanwhile, Wolves take on Bournemouth and Brighton host Everton at the same time. Later,  Chelsea  host  West Ham United  in a London derby and finally, we finish things off with  Liverpool  taking on  Newcastle United . Elsewhere across the continent, we have  Hamburg  hosting  Bundesliga  leaders  Bayern Munich , and  Elche  take on  LaLiga  leaders  Barcelona . Enjoy all the action from Saturday's matches.
